Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a misleading Facebook post and does not provide concrete evidence to support the assertion of Indian police assault during vehicle document inspection.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video is from 2017 and shows the policemen in Basti district of Uttar Pradesh beating up an alleged criminal, rather than an assault during vehicle document inspection.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the video depicts Indian police assault during vehicle document inspection, without considering alternative explanations or verifying the information.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the video, as it shows the police beating up an alleged criminal and not an assault during vehicle document inspection.
Understate: The claim may understate the severity of the incident by presenting it as a routine vehicle document inspection rather than a case of police brutality.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence of exaggeration in the claim as it does not make any sensational or inflated statements.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by relying on a misleading Facebook post and not providing accurate information about the incident.
